intro: Sida phlebococca, commonly known as yellow mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a soft, hairy texture. Sida phlebococca is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun.
